title.rendered: Yum Restaurants India Private Limited supports Smile Foundation’s Mission Education Programme

content.rendered:
Yum Restaurants India Private Limited supports Smile Foundation's Mission Education Programme

KFC is committed to serving the communities where it lives and works through Add Hope—a program created to help to end hunger through fundraising and active partnerships with organizations around the world. Through Add Hope, KFC India is committed to providing meals to underprivileged children and for this KFC has joined hands with Smile Foundation for supporting a meal program for 3500 underprivileged children. Smile Foundation has provided support for 3,85,000 meals to these underprivileged children from Odisha, Tripura, Nagaland, Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, Bihar, West Bengal, Assam, Telangana, Himachal Pradesh.


KFC is the world’s most popular chicken restaurant chain, specializing in famous Original Recipe fried chicken. It all started with one cook who created a finger lickin’ good recipe more than 75 years ago, a list of secret herbs and spices scratched out on the back of the door to his kitchen. That cook was Colonel Harland Sanders, of course, and today we still follow his formula for success, with real cooks breading and freshly preparing delicious chicken by hand in more than 20,000 restaurants in more than 125 countries. With the help of incredible franchise partners around the world, KFC has become one of the fastest growing retail brands, both in emerging and developed markets alike.
